data.value: The algorithm for MLS generation is generically described in:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maximum_length_sequence
The default values for taps are specifically taken from the first option listed for each value of
in:
https://web.archive.org/web/20181001062252/http://www.newwaveinstruments.com/resources/articles/m_sequence_linear_feedback_shift_register_lfsr.htm
Number of bits to use. Length of the resulting sequence will be
. Note that generating long sequences (e.g., greater than
) can take a long time.
If array, must be of length
, and will be cast to binary (bool) representation. If None, a seed of ones will be used, producing a repeatable representation. If
is all zeros, an error is raised as this is invalid. Default: None.
Number of samples to compute. If None, the entire length
is computed.
Polynomial taps to use (e.g.,
for an 8-bit sequence). If None, taps will be automatically selected (for up to
Resulting MLS sequence of 0's and 1's.
The final state of the shift register.
Maximum length sequence (MLS) generator.
